intro: Raphionacme ernstiana, commonly known as the Ernst's raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
